data.enText: trod
trodden
or
trod

data.chText: 踩；踏；践踏
data.enText: to put your foot down while you are stepping or walking

data.chText: 哎哟！你踩着我的脚指头了！
data.enText: Ouch! You trod on my toe!

data.chText: 小心，别踩着那水坑。
data.enText: Careful you don't tread in that puddle.

data.chText: 踩碎；践踏
data.enText: to crush or press sth with your feet

data.chText: 别把烟灰踩进地毯里！
data.enText: Don't tread ash into the carpet!

data.chText: 这种葡萄酒仍然是以传统的方法踩碎葡萄酿制的。
data.enText: The wine is still made by treading grapes in the traditional way.

data.chText: 行走；步行；走

data.enText: or
to walk somewhere

data.chText: 以前没有多少人走过这条小路。
data.enText: Few people had trod this path before.

data.chText: 他蹑手蹑脚地走着。
data.enText: He was treading quietly and cautiously.
tread carefully, warily, etc.

data.chText: 小心谨慎地说；小心翼翼地做
data.enText: to be very careful about what you do or say

data.chText: 政府在处理这个问题时须慎之又慎。
data.enText: The government will have to tread very carefully in handling this issue.
tread a difficult, dangerous, solitary, etc. path

data.chText: 走一条困难、危险、孤独等的人生道路（指选择特定的生活方式或处事方法）
data.enText: to choose and follow a particular way of life, way of doing sth, etc.

data.chText: 餐馆必须在保证质量和价格低廉之间走出一条困难的折中之路。
data.enText: A restaurant has to tread the tricky path between maintaining quality and keeping prices down.
tread on sb's heels

data.chText: 紧随某人之后；步人后尘
data.enText: to follow sb closely
tread on sb's toes
step on sb's toes

data.chText: 激怒，得罪，冒犯（尤指因插手他人职责）
data.enText: to offend or annoy sb, especially by getting involved in sth that is their responsibility
tread water

data.chText: 踩水（摆动四肢使身体在深水中保持直立）
data.enText: to keep yourself vertical in deep water by moving your arms and legs

data.chText: 裹足不前；徘徊观望
data.enText: to make no progress while you are waiting for sth to happen
walk/tread a fine/thin line

data.chText: 处于困境（或险境）；如履薄冰；走钢丝
data.enText: to be in a difficult or dangerous situation where you could easily make a mistake

data.chText: 他想滑稽而不粗鲁，难以把握分寸。
data.enText: He was walking a fine line between being funny and being rude.
tread/walk a tightrope

data.chText: 身处困境；如履薄冰
data.enText: to be in a difficult situation in which you do not have much freedom of action and need to be extremely careful about what you do

data.chText: 步法；步态；脚步声
data.enText: the way that sb walks; the sound that sb makes when they walk

data.chText: 我听到他在楼梯上的沉重脚步声。
data.enText: I heard his heavy tread on the stairs.

data.chText: （轮胎的）胎面；外胎花纹
data.enText: the raised pattern on the surface of a tyre on a vehicle

data.chText: 这些轮胎磨损得已低于胎面1.6毫米的法定厚度。
data.enText: The tyres were worn below the legal limit of 1.6mm of tread.

data.chText: （台阶或楼梯的）踏步板，梯面，踏面
data.enText: the upper surface of a step or stair
tread carefully, warily, etc.

data.chText: 小心谨慎地说；小心翼翼地做
data.enText: to be very careful about what you do or say

data.chText: 政府在处理这个问题时须慎之又慎。
data.enText: The government will have to tread very carefully in handling this issue.
tread a difficult, dangerous, solitary, etc. path

data.enText: to choose and follow a particular way of life, way of doing sth, etc.

data.chText: 餐馆必须在保证质量和价格低廉之间走出一条困难的折中之路。
data.enText: A restaurant has to tread the tricky path between maintaining quality and keeping prices down.

data.enText: to follow sb closely
tread on sb's toes

data.enText: to offend or annoy sb, especially by getting involved in sth that is their responsibility
tread water

data.enText: to keep yourself vertical in deep water by moving your arms and legs

data.enText: to make no progress while you are waiting for sth to happen
walk/tread a fine/thin line

data.chText: 他想滑稽而不粗鲁，难以把握分寸。
data.enText: He was walking a fine line between being funny and being rude.
tread/walk a tightrope

data.chText: 身处困境；如履薄冰
data.enText: to be in a difficult situation in which you do not have much freedom of action and need to be extremely careful about what you do

tr: a step in walking or running
structural member consisting of the horizontal part of a stair or step
the part (as of a wheel or shoe) that makes contact with the ground
the grooved surface of a pneumatic tire
brace (an archer's bow) by pressing the foot against the center
crush as if by treading on
tread or stomp heavily or roughly
example: The soldiers trampled across the fields

tr: put down or press the foot, place the foot
example: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread

value.def: If you tread on something, you put your foot on it when you are walking or standing.

example.ex: Oh, sorry, I didn't mean to tread on your foot...
example.tran: 哦，对不起，我不是故意踩你脚的。

example.ex: I had white rugs on the floor, but people were scared to tread on them in case they marked.
example.tran: 我在地板上铺了白色小地毯，但大家都不敢往上踩，以免在上面留下脚印。

value.def: If you tread in a particular way, you walk that way.

example.ex: She trod casually, enjoying the touch of the damp grass on her feet.
example.tran: 她信步而行，享受着湿漉漉的草地触及双脚的感觉。

value.def: A person's tread is the sound that they make with their feet as they walk.

example.ex: We could now very plainly hear their heavy tread.
example.tran: 我们现在可以非常清楚地听到他们沉重的脚步声。

value.def: If you tread carefully, you behave in a careful or cautious way.

example.ex: If you are hoping to form a new relationship tread carefully and slowly to begin with...
example.tran: 如果你希望建立新的关系，首先要慎重行事，不要着急。

example.ex: There are three reasons for treading warily in such matters.
example.tran: 这种事情需要谨慎行事有 3 个原因。

value.def: The tread of a step or stair is its flat upper surface.

example.ex: He walked up the stairs. The treads were covered with a kind of rubber and very quiet.
example.tran: 他走上楼梯。梯面上铺了一种橡胶，因此没有什么声响。

value.def: The tread of a tyre or shoe is the pattern of thin lines cut into its surface that stops it slipping.

example.ex: The fat, broad tyres had a good depth of tread.
example.tran: 这种宽大的轮胎有很深的胎面花纹。

value.def: If someone is treading a fine line or path, they are acting carefully because they have to avoid making a serious mistake, especially in a situation where they have to deal with two opposing demands.

example.ex: They have to tread the delicate path between informing children and boring them...
example.tran: 他们既要让孩子们了解情况，又不能让他们产生厌烦情绪，不得不小心把握分寸。

example.ex: The President will therefore have to tread a very fine line when he addresses the parliament.
example.tran: 因此，总统在向议会演讲时将不得不仔细拿捏分寸。

value.tran: 走钢丝般行事;小心地把握分寸

value.def: If you tread a particular path, you take a particular course of action or do something in a particular way.

example.ex: He continues to tread an unconventional path...
example.tran: 他还是不按传统方式行事。

example.ex: Stylistically, Weller is treading a similar path to that of Lenny Kravitz.
example.tran: 在风格上，韦勒与伦尼·克拉维茨走着相似的路子。

value.def: If someone who is in deep water treads water, they float in an upright position by moving their legs slightly.
If you say that someone is treading water, you mean that they are in an unsatisfactory situation where they are not progressing, but are just continuing doing the same things.

example.ex: I could either tread water until I was promoted, which looked to be a few years away, or I could change what I was doing.
example.tran: 我要么原地踏步直到获得晋升(这看来得是几年以后的事了)，要么改变现在正做的事情。
